Class File

  • java.lang.Object
    • File

  • public class File
extends Object
    A class of files.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Mark Dreesen, Tommy Messelis
    Invariants:
  • Each file must have a properly spelled name.
        isValidName(getName())
  • Each file must have a valid size.
        isValidSize(getSize())
  • Each file must have a valid creation time.
        isValidCreationTime(getCreationTime())
  • Each file must have a valid modification time.
        canHaveAsModificationTime(getModificationTime())

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Date creationTime
      Variable referencing the time of creation.
      private boolean isWritable
      Variable registering whether or not this file is writable.
      private static int maximumSize
      Variable registering the maximum size of any file (in bytes).
      private Date modificationTime
      Variable referencing the time of the last modification, possibly null.
      private String name
      Variable referencing the name of this file.
      private int size
      Variable registering the size of this file (in bytes).

    • Constructor Detail

      • File

        public File(String name,
            int size,
            boolean writable)
        Initialize a new file with given name, size and writability.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new file.
        size - The size of the new file.
        writable - The writability of the new file.
        Postconditions:
      • The new creation time of this file is initialized to some time during constructor execution.
            (new.getCreationTime().getTime() >= System.currentTimeMillis()) &&
            (new.getCreationTime().getTime() <= (new System).currentTimeMillis())
      • The new file has no time of last modification.
            new.getModificationTime() == null
        • Effects:
      • The name of the file is set to the given name. If the given name is not valid, a default name is set.
            setName(name)
      • The size is set to the given size (must be valid)
            setSize(size)
      • The writability is set to the given flag
            setWritable(writable)

      • File

        public File(String name)
        Initialize a new file with given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new file.
        Effect:
        This new file is initialized with the given name, a zero size and true writability
            this(name,0,true)

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        @Raw
 @Basic
public String getName()
        Return the name of this file.

      • isValidName

        public static boolean isValidName(String name)
        Check whether the given name is a legal name for a file.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be checked
        Returns:
        True if the given string is effective, not empty and consisting only of letters, digits, dots, hyphens and underscores; false otherwise.
            result ==
             (name != null) && name.matches("[a-zA-Z_0-9.-]+")

      • setName

        @Raw
 @Model
private void setName(String name)
        Set the name of this file to the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name for this file.
        Postcondition:
        If the given name is valid, the name of this file is set to the given name, otherwise the name of the file is set to a valid name (the default).
            if (isValidName(name))
                 then new.getName().equals(name)
                 else new.getName().equals(getDefaultName())

      • getDefaultName

        @Raw
 @Model
private String getDefaultName()
        Return the name for a new file which is to be used when the given name is not valid.
        Returns:
        A valid file name.
            isValidName(result)

      • changeName

        public void changeName(String name)
                throws FileNotWritableException
        Change the name of this file to the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name for this file.
        Effects:
      • The name of this file is set to the given name, if this is a valid name and the file is writable, otherwise there is no change.
            if (isValidName(name) && isWritable())
            then setName(name)
      • If the name is valid and the file is writable, the modification time of this file is updated.
            if (isValidName(name) && isWritable())
            then setModificationTime()
        • Throws:
        FileNotWritableException(this) - This file is not writable | ! isWritable()
        FileNotWritableException

      • getSize

        @Raw
 @Basic
public int getSize()
        Return the size of this file (in bytes).

      • setSize

        @Raw
 @Model
private void setSize(int size)
        Set the size of this file to the given size.
        Parameters:
        size - The new size for this file.
        Precondition:
        The given size must be legal.
            isValidSize(size)
        Postcondition:
        The given size is registered as the size of this file.
            new.getSize() == size

      • getMaximumSize

        @Basic
 @Immutable
public static int getMaximumSize()
        Return the maximum file size.

      • isValidSize

        public static boolean isValidSize(int size)
        Check whether the given size is a valid size for a file.
        Parameters:
        size - The size to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given size is positive and does not exceed the maximum size.
            result == ((size >= 0) && (size <= getMaximumSize()))

      • enlarge

        public void enlarge(int delta)
             throws FileNotWritableException
        Increases the size of this file with the given delta.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount of bytes by which the size of this file must be increased.
        Precondition:
        The given delta must be strictly positive.
            delta > 0
        Effect:
        The size of this file is increased with the given delta.
            changeSize(delta)
        Throws:
        FileNotWritableException

      • shorten

        public void shorten(int delta)
             throws FileNotWritableException
        Decreases the size of this file with the given delta.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount of bytes by which the size of this file must be decreased.
        Precondition:
        The given delta must be strictly positive.
            delta > 0
        Effect:
        The size of this file is decreased with the given delta.
            changeSize(-delta)
        Throws:
        FileNotWritableException

      • changeSize

        @Model
private void changeSize(int delta)
                        throws FileNotWritableException
        Change the size of this file with the given delta.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount of bytes by which the size of this file must be increased or decreased.
        Precondition:
        The given delta must not be 0
            delta != 0
        Effects:
      • The size of this file is adapted with the given delta.
            setSize(getSize()+delta)
      • The modification time is updated.
            setModificationTime()
        • Throws:
        FileNotWritableException(this) - This file is not writable. | ! isWritable()
        FileNotWritableException

      • getCreationTime

        @Raw
 @Basic
 @Immutable
public Date getCreationTime()
        Return the time at which this file was created.

      • isValidCreationTime

        public static boolean isValidCreationTime(Date date)
        Check whether the given date is a valid creation time.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given date is effective and not in the future.
            result ==
             (date != null) &&
             (date.getTime() <= System.currentTimeMillis())

      • getModificationTime

        @Raw
 @Basic
public Date getModificationTime()
        Return the time at which this file was last modified, that is at which the name or size was last changed. If this file has not yet been modified after construction, null is returned.

      • canHaveAsModificationTime

        public boolean canHaveAsModificationTime(Date date)
        Check whether this file can have the given date as modification time.
        Parameters:
        date - The date to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given date is either not effective or if the given date lies between the creation time and the current time.
            result == (date == null) ||
            ( (date.getTime() >= getCreationTime().getTime()) &&
              (date.getTime() <= System.currentTimeMillis())     )

      • setModificationTime

        @Model
private void setModificationTime()
        Set the modification time of this file to the current time.
        Postconditions:
      • The new modification time is effective.
            new.getModificationTime() != null
      • The new modification time lies between the system time at the beginning of this method execution and the system time at the end of method execution.
            (new.getModificationTime().getTime() >=
                               System.currentTimeMillis()) &&
            (new.getModificationTime().getTime() <=
                               (new System).currentTimeMillis())

      • hasOverlappingUsePeriod

        public boolean hasOverlappingUsePeriod(File other)
        Return whether this file and the given other file have an overlapping use period.
        Parameters:
        other - The other file to compare with.
        Returns:
        False if the other file is not effective False if the prime object does not have a modification time False if the other file is effective, but does not have a modification time otherwise, true if and only if the open time intervals of this file and the other file overlap
            if (other == null) then result == false else
            if ((getModificationTime() == null)||
                  other.getModificationTime() == null)
               then result == false
               else
            result ==
            ! (getCreationTime().before(other.getCreationTime()) &&
              getModificationTime().before(other.getCreationTime()) ) &&
            ! (other.getCreationTime().before(getCreationTime()) &&
              other.getModificationTime().before(getCreationTime()) )

      • isWritable

        @Raw
 @Basic
public boolean isWritable()
        Check whether this file is writable.

      • setWritable

        @Raw
public void setWritable(boolean isWritable)
        Set the writability of this file to the given writability.
        Parameters:
        isWritable - The new writability
        Postcondition:
        The given writability is registered as the new writability for this file.
            new.isWritable() == isWritable
